name: Let's Talk About Shame - Wellness Workshop
description:
Shame is among the most painful & detrimental emotions one experiences in a lifetime. A sense of worthlessness or undeservingness to exist consume those afflicted by shame. The pivotal role of shame is seen in maladaptive experiences such as shyness, addiction, loneliness, persistent anxiety, low mood and interpersonal behaviors including appeasement, hiding discontent, affirming to partner abuse/neglect, violence and preoccupation/avoidance
This workshop intends to help individuals understand shame in self and relationships, the experiences which may have played a role in shame overwhelming one’s experiences and strategies to address shame.
The workshop is organised by Dr Mathai Fenn, Dr Nimesh George And Dr Gokul Ratakonda, all of whom are practising psychotherapists and psychologists.
performer:
Gokul R. , 
Mathai Fenn, 
Nimesh George,

name: RCB Quiz - Sports Quiz
description:
Ee Saala Quiz Namde! Get Ready for the Ultimate RCB Quiz Experience!
It’s that time of the year again! Our minds are buzzing with India’s mega cricket carnival, and our hearts are brimming with love for our favourite team—RCB!
This is your chance to relive those unforgettable moments from RCB games, dive into fun facts about the legendary players, and celebrate your fandom with fellow die-hard supporters!
Peripheral Vision Collaborative is thrilled to bring you RCB Quiz – Inaugural Edition!
Join us for a day of fun, excitement, and RCB magic at Atta Galatta, Indiranagar on April 27th, 2025 at 11 AM!
🎤 Hosted by: Navneeth Krishna – Television Presenter & former host of RCB 12th Man TV
 🎬 Co-hosted by: Neerav Ghosh – Filmmaker, Author & Director/Producer of Breakfast with Champions
Form your dream ‘2-member team’ and put your cricket knowledge to the test!
Don't wait – REGISTER NOW and lock in your spot!
Will you come out on top?

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
No agenda. No icebreakers. Just a cozy space, kind people, and time to just be—draw, journal, knit, doodle, zone out... whatever feels good. 💭🖍
We’ll have some optional art stuff, quiet corners, and probably a bit of wholesome chaos too. Bring a project or just bring yourself. That’s more than enough.
This space is exclusively for LGBTQIA+ folks. We haven’t opened it up to allies just yet—thank you for understanding. 🏳‍🌈
🌈 Spots are limited—sign up!

name: Scribble - Storytelling
description:
When was the last time you scribbled on the walls and your parents didn’t say a word? You love doodling on paper, but what about those forbidden floors, doors, and walls? Dive into our scribble-filled adventure, where creativity runs wild!
Meghna Shirish a mom, artist, and professional photographer who treats color like it’s her lifeline. If she had her way, she`d transform the entire city into a canvas of vibrant scribbles!

name: Read A Kitaab - Monthly Book Club
description:
📖 Theme: Books That Healed You
📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
📅 Date: Sunday, 27th April 2025
⏰ Time: 4:00 PM – 6:00 PM
📚 Join us for a thought-provoking discussion on books that healed you! Connect with fellow book lovers and celebrate literature that shapes perspectives!
Please note: This is for strictly bookish / literature conversation and no personal life discussions/rave or rant.

name: Two Volumes of Captivating Short Stories - Book Launch
description:
A Joy Ride!
The stories in the two volumes of captivating short stories by Vijay Padaki are packed with a variety of plots and a charming range of characters. The first volume is The First Offering and Other Stories: Wagging Tales and the second volume is The Last Cheetah and Other Stories: Wagging Tales. They combine intriguing content with witty narration. The stories are kept short and sweet, never imposing, always entertaining.
Padmavati Rao, eminent theatre and film personality will be in conversation with the author to launch the books.

name: Famous Last Questions: A Confused Woman’s Investigations into the Country that Shaped Her - Book Launch
description:
India’s ’90s kids grew up in an offline world and graduated to one that’s hyperconnected and seemingly always on fire. This generation’s psyche is riddled with qualms about identity, politics, capitalism, technology, relationships, selfhood, and what it means to live authentically—and in Famous Last Questions, Sanjana Ramachandran strikes at the heart of their confusion.
She is sincere and ironic, self-flagellating and observant, and witheringly funny. In a heroic attempt to understand why she is the way she is, she takes a scalpel to her childhood trauma and ends up with the socio-political machinery that set the scene for it, thinking out loud: Why is ‘Science, Arts, or Commerce’ how we decide the course of our lives? Why must we believe in God? Should women get married before the age of thirty, or die trying? Why is domesticity so difficult when she isn’t the ‘perfect’ housewife? How has the internet exposed Indian culture? And can virtue actually kill people?
Famous Last Questions plays with the boundaries of memoir, reportage, and research, and is a must-read for anyone grappling with these questions! Join us for the launch of this riveting book at Atta Galatta on 27th April, at 7 PM.

name: Music Camp 2025 - Music Summer Camp
description:
As we melt away this summer, we may as well do it to a beat. Taaqademy Presents - Music Camp 2025
Camp Content

Song Learning - Students will develop a repertoire of songs that they can perform
Everyone gets exposed to and gets to touch and feel all instruments - Gtr, Drums, Keys, Ukulele, Percussion, Vocals.
Students can choose a preferred stream of learning: Guitar, Keyboard, Drums, Vocals. (Or our teacher can help you choose too)
Music Appreciation - designed to enrich the student's listening experience by introducing various instruments, genres, history & evolution of styles, artists.
Basic Music Theory
Instruments will be provided!
Outcome - End of batch group Recitals

We have a flexible Hop On Hop Off schedule and will be happy to fit it within your summer holiday plans.
Let the kids sweat it out with some music. They will love it.

name: Gond Art Workshop - Art Workshop
description:
Indian Gond Art - A Tribal Folk Art practiced by one of the largest tribes in India called Gondi, from Madhya Pradesh. The history of the Gond people dates nearly 1400 years from the Dravidian origin and this community has a unique painting style that makes extensive use of dots, fine lines, dashes and other geometric shapes.
The imagery of these paintings are borderless, bold and loud.
Blended with mystery, humour, these art pieces depict a modern psyche.
A great form of art to start with your basic art skill, interesting and electrified art that gets you fascinated about Indian Art Forms!!
You need not have any prior experience in drawing or painting in order to attend this course.
Note: All Materials will be provided by the host.
What will you take home?
Knowledge of Indian Art Culture
Learn an ancient art form
Completed piece of artwork done by yourself
What do you need to bring?
Water bottle to keep you hydrated.
This workshop includes all materials, if required kindly get an Examination Pad / Paper Board.
Kindly be on time, entry of the participants will not be allowed late beyond 15 minutes.
No refunds on cancellations.

name: Curios Minds, Conscious Choices: The Power of Asking Why - Meetup
description:
How does the content you consume shape your thoughts, decisions, and behavior?
Are you curious about the root causes of human behavior?
Do you want the freedom to challenge every statement and engage in an open discussion?
Looking for unbiased answers to your toughest questions?
Join us for an interactive Q&A-based session that encourages critical thinking and questioning!
This session is part of #MyConsumptionMyResponsibility, an initiative by Simon Jakkam aimed at raising awareness about how information, media, and content consumption profoundly impact our thoughts, behaviors, and overall well-being—especially among young minds.
What Makes This Session Unique?
✅ 100% Q&A-based: No lectures—only real discussions! I’ll answer questions directly from the audience.
✅ Challenge My Answers: You can counter-question every statement I make until you're completely satisfied with the response.
✅ Root-Cause Analysis: My responses will go beyond surface-level explanations and focus on why things happen the way they do.
Why Is This Important?
With digital consumption at an all-time high, even young children are exposed to unfiltered content that shapes their thinking and behavior—often without them realizing it. They cannot filter what’s right or wrong. This makes mindful consumption a necessity, not a choice. Understanding its impact is the need of the hour as it influences every aspect of life.
Come, challenge, question, and discover how mindful consumption can transform your life!

name: The Middle of Everything - Book Launch
description:
The Middle of Everything is a delightful collection of life’s essence and encapsulates 56 short humorous and inspirational pieces.
Vivek Atray, the Author is also Motivational Speaker and an ex-IAS officer. Hiis 5th book, ‘The Middle of Everything’ contains titles like "A Yawning Divide", "Bad Hair Days" and "He held her Hand".  Fern Tree is the publisher of the book.
The Middle of Everything by Vivek Atray is a book that exemplifies all that is cheerful and peppy in life. The pages of this book will calm your mind and warm your heart. The Middle of Everything is a motley mélange of middles (short humorous or inspirational pieces) published on the editorial pages of leading newspapers.
Join us for the launch, only at Atta Galatta, Indiranagar, on 3rd May at 3 PM!

name: Echoes of Spring - Painting Workshop
description: Join us for a fun multimedia floral painting workshop! We’ll create a dreamy scene with a soft, blurred background and vibrant wildflowers up close. Learn to add depth and texture using simple techniques. All materials will be provided!

name: Harry Potter Book Discussion - Meetup
description:
For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!
Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!
Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.
The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

name: Shaam-e-Sukhan - Ghazal and Sufi Performance
description:
An enchanting evening of romantic ghazal & divine sufi melodies awaits you let the soulful voice of Koyel Mukherjee vocalist, (Zee Saregamapa fame), the mesmerising tabla by Partha Chatterjee and magical keys of Rishabh Chauhan takes you on the journey of love, divineness and tranquillity.
The band name is Ruh_voyage previously called as Ruhaniyat_sufi.

description:
Immerse yourself on a journey of self-discovery through journaling and art!
 
Dates: 13th May 2025 to 16th May 2025
Timing: 11.30 AM to 1.30 PM
Pricing is Rs 9000 per person for a 5-day session.
Material is provided
Batch size 5 people only
For more details, please call at 8660217440 or 9902059257

name: Nature Workshop - Workshop
description:
Tap into your creativity with this nature workshop, learn how to green your spaces, care for indoor plants, plant assortments and make your own indoor planter.
By appointment only, a session can be scheduled by calling 8660217440 or 9902059257, and between the following dates and times: 
Dates: 13th May 2025 to 16th May 2025
Timing: 11.30 AM to 1.30 PM
Ticket Price: INR 1500 per person, per day
Single day workshop
Batch size 5 people only
Material is provided
Once you've finalized the date and time with the facilitators, please fill out the registration form and make the payment!

name: Art for a Cause - Creative Workshop on Journaling
description:
Immerse yourself on a journey of self-discovery through journaling and art!
 
Dates: 13th May 2025 to 16th May 2025
Timing: 11.30 AM to 1.30 PM
Pricing is Rs 9000 per person for a 5-day session.
Material is provided
Batch size 5 people only
For more details, please call at 8660217440 or 9902059257

name: Nature Workshop - Workshop
description:
Tap into your creativity with this nature workshop, learn how to green your spaces, care for indoor plants, plant assortments and make your own indoor planter.
By appointment only, a session can be scheduled by calling 8660217440 or 9902059257, and between the following dates and times: 
Dates: 13th May 2025 to 16th May 2025
Timing: 11.30 AM to 1.30 PM
Ticket Price: INR 1500 per person, per day
Single day workshop
Batch size 5 people only
Material is provided
Once you've finalized the date and time with the facilitators, please fill out the registration form and make the payment!

name: Music Camp 2025 - Music Summer Camp
description:
As we melt away this summer, we may as well do it to a beat. Taaqademy Presents - Music Camp 2025
Camp Content

Song Learning - Students will develop a repertoire of songs that they can perform
Everyone gets exposed to and gets to touch and feel all instruments - Gtr, Drums, Keys, Ukulele, Percussion, Vocals.
Students can choose a preferred stream of learning: Guitar, Keyboard, Drums, Vocals. (Or our teacher can help you choose too)
Music Appreciation - designed to enrich the student's listening experience by introducing various instruments, genres, history & evolution of styles, artists.
Basic Music Theory
Instruments will be provided!
Outcome - End of batch group Recitals

We have a flexible Hop On Hop Off schedule and will be happy to fit it within your summer holiday plans.
Let the kids sweat it out with some music. They will love it.

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
No agenda. No icebreakers. Just a cozy space, kind people, and time to just be—draw, journal, knit, doodle, zone out... whatever feels good. 💭🖍
We’ll have some optional art stuff, quiet corners, and probably a bit of wholesome chaos too. Bring a project or just bring yourself. That’s more than enough.
This space is exclusively for LGBTQIA+ folks. We haven’t opened it up to allies just yet—thank you for understanding. 🏳‍🌈
🌈 Spots are limited—sign up!
